figure.head: FIG.
figure.figDesc:
a) σ 1 (ν) and b) σ 2 (ν) for Y 1−x Pr x Ba 2 Cu 3 O 7 at T = 50 K, x = 0 (squares), 0.2 (circles), 0.3
(dotted curve), 0.4 (dash-dotted curve), and 1.0 (short-dashed curve). The solid and dashed upper curves
are fits to a frequency-dependent Drude form (see text).

figure.head: FIG.
figure.figDesc:
a) σ 2 (T ) and b) σ 1 (T ) for the four Pr concentrations x = 0 (squares), 0.2 (circles), 0.3 (solid
triangles), 0.4 (open triangles) at 480 GHz. The dashed curves in b) show 1/ρ * . The vertical lines indicate
T ac
c . For clarity, the data for x = 0.3 in b) has been multiplied by 1.5.

figure.head: FIG.
figure.figDesc:
a) The dc resistivity ρ(T ) and b) the normalized dc resistivity ρ * (T ) for x= 0, 0.2, 0.3, and 0.4
(solid, dashed, dotted, and dash-dotted curves).

figure.head: FIG.
figure.figDesc:
Normalized London penetration depth λ L (T /T ac
c ) for x = 0.0 (squares), 0.2 (circles), 0.3 (solid
triangles), 0.4 (open triangles). Also shown are curves corresponding to the predictions of BCS theory (solid
line), as well as to the functional form (5) for α = 1 (dash-dotted line), 2 (dashed line), and 4 (dotted line).

figure.head: FIG.
figure.figDesc:
Quasiparticle scattering rate 1/τ (T ) for x = 0 (squares), 0.2 (circles), and 0.4 (triangles) at
480 GHz.
